ngoList.address: DR G.P. SRIVASTAVA, HONY. GENERAL SECRETARY, INDIAN SOCIETY OF AGRICULTURAL BIOCHEMISTS, Department of Agicultural Biochemistry, C.S. Azad University of Agriculture and Technology, KANPUR-200802
ngoList.title: Indian Society of Agricultural Biochemists
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Indian Society of Agricultural Biochemists was founded in the year 1985 with the Headquarters in the Department of Agricultural Biochemists C.S.Azad University of Agriculture & Technology, Kanpur. Major achievements of the society is briefly as under 1. The society is regularly publishing its six monthly journal namely Indian journal of Agricultural Biochemistry since 1988. The last published issue was vol. 29, no.2, Dec. 2016. Presently it has NAAS rating of 4.69. 2. The Society is regularly organizing National and International conferences/Symposia alongwith its convention since 1988. So far it organized Eight National and five International conference. The eight National Symposia/Conferences were organized at C.S.A.U.&T., Kanpur in 1988; at N.D. University of Agriculture and Technology, Kumarganj, Faizabad in 1991; at Banaras Hindu University in 1995; at Lucknow University in 1996; at Gujarat Agri. University, Junagarh in 1998; at C.S.A.U.&T. Kanpurin 2000; at Tamil Nadu Agricultural University, Coimbatore in 2001 and at Assam Aricultural University, Jorhat, Assam in 2003. The International Conferences were oganized at Indian Agricultural Research Institute New Delhi in 1993; at C.S.A.U.T. Kanpur in 2006; at Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi in 2010; at Venkatashwara University, Tirupati, A.P. in 2013 and at Anand Agricultural University, Anand, Gujarat in 2016. 3. The Society opened its five chapters in different universities such as CSKHPKV, Palampur, H.P. in 1996; at Assam Agricultural University, Jorhat, Assam in 2003; at Punjab Agricultural University, Ludhiyana in 2008; at the Rubber Reseasch Institute of India, Kottayam, Kerala in 2014 and Gujarat chapter at Anand Agricultural University, Anand, Gujarat in 2017. 4. The Siciety Published the Proceedings of the International Conference held at I.A.R.I., New Delhi in 1993; Proceeding of the National Symposium held at Gujarat Agricultural University, Junagadh in 1998 and Proceedings (in book form) of the International Conference held at C.S.A.U.&T.Kanpur in 2006. 5. The Palampur chapter of the society published the proceedings of the Seminar held their in 2000.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Indian Society of Agroforestry (ISAF) was founded in 1998 to promote client-oriented ecologically sustainable range and forage husbandry with economic productivity and to support excellence in scientific research in agriculture with focus on agroforestry, environment, and allied sciences. One of the major objectives of the Society is to provide national and global platform to the scientists, development workers, practitioners, planners and policy makers, industrialists, financial managers and donors related to grassland and fodder resources development for exchange of ideas for the benefit of the humanity. The Society has organized several workshops, seminars, symposia and conferences in the past, as well as 3rd World Congress on Agroforestry, February 10-14, 2014 in New Delhi.

ngoList.title: INNOVATIVE CANCER RESEARCH And THERAPY FOUNDATION
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Initially Public Awareness activities such as seminars and public lectures were instituted highlighting the evils of the various types of tobacco including not only smoking but also tobacco chews and dental powders containing tobacco. The importance of genital hygiene and avoiding promiscuity to reduce both cancer cervix as well as penile cancers was emphasized. Hepatitis B vaccination was stressed. Efforts to develop targeted therapy were initiated including using radiolabelled moieties.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: To achieve objects trust for the prevention and treatment of cancers particularly utilising targated therapy which have relativily limited toxicity it was considered important to enlist the cooperation of the members of the Agra public and with a view to this public awareness seminars were organized in relation to the common causes of cancer in tha Agra region such as the use of Mainpuri tobacco chews, inadequate gental hygeine and hepatitis B and C virurses. donations from the public resulted.

To achieve objects trust for the prevention and treatment of cancers particularly utilising targated therapy which have relativily limited toxicity it was considered important to enlist the cooperation of the members of the Agra public and with a view to this public awareness seminars were organized in relation to the common causes of cancer in tha Agra region including various forms of Tobacco.and public lectures were organised regarding methods of reducing this addiction.Donations followed.

To achieve objects trust for the prevention and treatment of cancers particularly utilising targated therapy which have relativily limited toxicity it was considered important to enlist the cooperation of the members of the Agra public and with a view to this public awareness seminars were organized in relation to the common causes of cancer in tha Agra region such as the use of Mainpuri tobacco chews, inadequate gental hygeine and hepatitis B and C virurses. donations from the public resulted.

To achieve objects trust for the prevention and treatment of cancers particularly utilising targated therapy which have relativily limited toxicity it was considered important to enlist the cooperation of the members of the Agra public and with a view to this public awareness seminars were organized in relation to the common causes of cancer in tha Agra region such as the use of Mainpuri tobacco chews, inadequate gental hygeine and hepatitis B and C virurses. donations from the public resulted.

Aa an previous years public awareness drives regarding the quantum of cancers in the Agra region were organised on World Cancer Day and other National occasions and members of the public were requested to donate for the prevention of cancer as well as the creation of research and therapy facilities.Enthusiastic response was elicited including volunteers offering not only dedicated services but also financial contributions for the creations of these facilities.

This year too the foundation has embarked on fund collection from the public of Agra, which had already been sensitized in the previous years .Our plans for creating novel methods of targeted therapy were emphasis ed and the active involvement of senior clinicians was highlighted.The expansion of research activities and augmentation of diagnostic facilities was blue printed emphasising availibility to the financialy limited weaker sections.Donations have started.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: IASDS ranked 6 among regional level institutes, 5 among expertise and received highest score under item projects in an evaluation done by CSO of 289 agencies at National level for assesing survey capabilities of agencies. The institute aims at promotion of quantitative components in applied research relevant to development activities in national perpective for building up an overall welfare oriented strategy in entire socio-economic sector. The main functions of the institute are in the areas of in-service training, research projects and consultancy. The institute has leadership in specific areas like survey methodology and conducting large scale survey based studies including baseline, monitoring and evaluation, field experimentation, field experimentation and their analysis and quantitative methods including econometrics, perspective planning , projections and modeling. It has already acclaimed recognition by conducting studies in primary education, nutrition, HIV/AIDS, agriculture including land use, animal husbandry and rural development. It has provided substantial inputs in database needed in preparation of U.P. State Plan of action for Education for All. Some of the organizations for whom the institute has conducted projects/studies include UNICEF, CARE, WFP, MOST, A2Z, Intrahealth International- USAID, IRMS, NIMS, NFI, NAAS, SCERT, State AIDS control Society, ICMR, CSO, U.P. Export Corporation, Remote Sensing Applications Centre, ICAR, State Institute for Rural Development, Land Use Board, Ministry of Rural Development and Cooperation,NBRI and a host of other organizations.
